title: The Challenge of Previous Relapse
description: Relapse is a common part of the recovery journey, but stigma surrounding relapse can be particularly damaging:

list.title: Self-Stigma
list.description: Individuals may internalize societal judgments, leading to feelings of shame and hopelessness.

list.title: Support System Breakdown
list.description: Friends and family may lose faith in the individualâ€™s ability to recover, reducing critical support.

list.title: Healthcare Reluctance
list.description: Fear of being judged by healthcare providers can prevent individuals from seeking help after a relapse.

summary: Promoting a compassionate understanding that relapse is often a part of recovery can help reduce stigma and encourage continuous efforts toward sobriety.
